block.p: Leah Kristina Benjamin and Andre Marko Pogacar were married yesterday afternoon in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Gomidas Baghsarian, an Armenian Apostolic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Spyridon Greek Orthodox Church.
Ms. Benjamin, 31, is keeping her name. She is a senior designer of the women's clothing collection at Calvin Klein in New York. She graduated from Parsons School of Design.

Leah Kristina Benjamin and Andre Marko Pogacar were married yesterday afternoon in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Gomidas Baghsarian, an Armenian Apostolic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Spyridon Greek Orthodox Church.

Leah Kristina Benjamin and Andre Marko Pogacar were married yesterday afternoon in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Gomidas Baghsarian, an Armenian Apostolic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Spyridon Greek Orthodox Church.
Ms. Benjamin, 31, is keeping her name. She is a senior designer of the women's clothing collection at Calvin Klein in New York. She graduated from Parsons School of Design.

She is the daughter of Susan F. Benjamin of Towson, Md., and Gordon L. Benjamin III of Newport. Her father is a carpenter in Newport. Her mother is a special education resource teacher at Arundel Elementary/Middle School in Baltimore.

Mr. Pogacar, 36, is a television editor in New York. This year he was the supervising editor for ''Sensing Murder,'' a series on the Discovery Channel produced by Granada. He graduated from McGill University in Montreal and received a master's degree in film from Boston University.

He is a son of Dr. Aida K. Pogacar and Dr. Srecko J. Pogacar of Cranston, R.I. His mother is a dentist with Danish & O'Laughlin, a group practice, and his father is a psychiatrist, both in Warwick, R.I.
